Are structural and non structural elements has sufficent fire resistance ratings as per table 3?
Are doorway or opening in a fire resistant wall on any floor is 5.6 m2 in area with a maximum height/width of 2.75 m for type 1 - 3 construction?
Are wall opening protected with fire resistance doors with fire rating not less than 120 min?

Openings in walls or floors which are necessary to be provided to allow passages of all building services like cables, electrical wirings, telephone cables, plumbing pipes, etc, shall be protected by enclosure in the form of ducts/shafts having a fire resistance not less than 120 min?
The space between the electrical cables/conduits and the walls/slabs shall be filled in by a fire stop material having fire resistance rating of not less than 120 min?
For plumbing shafts in the core of the building, with shaft door opening inside the building, the shafts shall have inspection doors having fire resistance rating not less than 30 min?
Are emergency power supplying distribution system for critical requirement for functioning of fire and life safety system and equipment planned for efficient and reliable power?

Is there a stand by generator as back up to the critical building systems including fire pumps, pressurization & smoke venting, fire lifts, exit signages lighting, emergency lighting, fire alarm system, PAGA, magnetic door locks, ligthing in fire command center?

Is the power supply to the panel/ Distribution boards of these fire and life safety systems safeguarded with fire proof enclosures and location of such systems are in fire safe zone ensuring power supply to these systems?
Whether adequate illumination with alternate power supply is provided for safe movement of persons towards and through the exits?
Whether adequate illumination with alternate power supply is provided for locating fire alarm call points and fire fighting equipments?
Whether emergency lighting is independently connected and can be operated by one switch on the ground floor which is easily accessible to Fire Fighters?
Are lighting arrestors provided in accordance with NBC part 4 life & safety  ligthing protection of buildings?

Are air conditioning and ventillation systems installed such that the danger ofspread of fire, smoke or fumes from one floor to other or from outside to any occupied building or structure is minimized
Are fire dampers installed which has minimum fire resistance rating of 120 min
Air ducts serving main floor areas, corridors, etc, shall not pass through the exits/exit passageway/ exit enclosure. Exits and lift lobbies, etc, shall not be used as return air passage.

the ducts pass through fire walls or floors, the opening around the ducts shall be sealed with materials having fire resistance rating of the compartment. Such duct shall also be provided with fire dampers at all fire walls and floors with fire resitance rating of not less than 120 min.
Are fire/ smoke dampers installed to supply air ducts , fresh air and return air ducts  which shall provide proper passive fire protection sealing in case of fire.
Are the surface interior finishing materials used such that it will reduce the flame spread and do not generate toxic smoke/ fumes?
Is there a separate fire command center or designated space to house Fire alarm system, CCTV system,PAGA, building managements system, and constructed with 120 min fire resistance rating walls?
Detailed floor plan along with details of fire fighting equipment and installations maintained in Fire command center?

Whether the floors of the building are provided with exits for every travel distance of 30 meters (TYPE 1 & 2 constructions) as per table 22 under  TYPE 3 & 4 constructions the travel distance is 22.5 Meters. Part 4 of NBC.
Whether the minimum number of two separate exits are provided for each floor ?

Every exit, exit passageway and exit discharge shall be continuously maintained free of all obstructions or impediments to full use in the case of fire or other
emergency.
Exits shall be so arranged that they may be reached without passing through another occupied unit/passage in others control, if they pose challenge or restriction in means of egress.
Whether all the internal stair cases, lift, lobbies and corridors are adequately ventilated and illuminated of IS 14435:1997?
Doors in exits shall open in the direction of exit.
Whether the height of exit door ways is 02-00 meters and more.
Are ramps , sloped surfaces, staricases shall be used with handrails.
The capacity of the means of egress required from any storey of the building shall not be reduced along the path of egress travel until arrival to the exit discharge.

Suitable means shall be provided so that all access controlled exit doors, turnstiles, boom barriers and other such exits shall automatically operate to open
mode during emergencies like fire, smoke, acts of terrorism, etc, so that people can safely and quickly egress into safe areas outside.

Smoke exhaust system / mechanical ventillation systems where provided, for above areas and occupancies shall have a minimum of 12 air changes  per  hour.
Are each basement seperately ventillated.

Are Inlets and extracts terminated at ground level with stall board or pavement lights as before. Stall board and pavement lights should be in positions easily accessible to the fire brigade and clearly marked AIR INLET or SMOKE OUTLET with an indication of area served at or near the opening.

Does the smoke extraction system operate on actuation of flow switch actuation of sprinkler system. In addition, a local and/or remote manual start-stop control/switch shall be provided for operations by the fire fighters.

Are thermal detectors installed in fume hoods and arrangements made for automatic tripping of the exhaust fan in case of fire.
Are manifold installed are away from any air intakes/smoke exhaust openings/ any windows.
Pressure regulating stations shall be designed and installed at critical locations for excess flow shut off valves.
Kitchens working on LPG fuel shall not be permitted in basements.
Rooms containing high pressure boilers, refrigerating machinery, transformers or other service equipment subject to possible explosion shall not be located directly under or adjacent to exits.
